chh.util

Class Random

  • java.lang.Object
    • chh.util.Random

  • public final class Random
extends java.lang.Object
    A class with methods for generating random numbers.
    Version:
    2010.04.16
    Author:
    Christopher H. Harvey

    • Method Detail

      • randDouble

        public static double randDouble(double low,
                double high)
        Selects a uniformly distributed random rational number within a given interval.
        Parameters:
        low - the minimum of the interval
        high - the exclusive least upper bound of the interval
        Returns:
        a random double-precision number within the interval [low, high).

      • randDouble

        public static double randDouble()
        Selects a uniformly distributed random rational number within the interval [0,1).
        Returns:
        a random double-precision number within the interval [0.0, 1.0)

      • randInt

        public static int randInt(int high)
        Selects a uniformly distributed random non-negative integer less than the given parameter. In other words, selects an integer within the interval [0, high).
        Parameters:
        high - the exclusive (non-inclusive) least upper bound of the interval
        Returns:
        a randomly selected integer less than high

      • randInt

        public static int randInt(int low,
          int high)
        Selects a uniformly distributed random signed integer within the interval [low, high).
        Parameters:
        low - the minimum of the interval
        high - the exclusive least upper bound of the interval
        Returns:
        a randomly selected integer in the half-open interval [low,high).

      • randBoolean

        public static boolean randBoolean(double p)
        Selects a Boolean value with a probability p of being true. p must be within the interval (0.0, 1.0) to have any random significance, but this method will take any double as an argument. If p <= 0 then this method will always return false, and if p >= 1 then this method will always return true.
        Parameters:
        p - the probability that this method will return true
        Returns:
        a Boolean value with p probability of being true

      • randBoolean

        public static boolean randBoolean()
        Selects a Boolean value with a 50% probability of being true.
        Returns:
        true, 50% of the time this method is called

      • randGaussian

        public static double randGaussian()
        Selects a random double that follows the Gaussian (normally) distributed probability density function, with mean 0 and standard deviation 1 (the standard normal distribution). This method uses the polar form of the Box-Muller Transformation.
        Returns:
        a standard normally distributed double-precision number

      • randGaussian

        public static double randGaussian(double mean,
                  double stdev)
        Selects a random double that follows the Gaussian (normally) distributed probability density function, with given mean and standard deviation.
        Parameters:
        mean - the mean of the normal distribution
        stdev - the standard deviation of the normal distribution
        Returns:
        a normally distributed double-precision number

      • randObj

        public static <T> T randObj(T obj1,
            T obj2)
        Randomly returns one of two given objects, with a 50% chance of each. The compile-time class of the returned object will be the least common compile-time superclass of the object parameters; that is, the closest related compile-time class that the objects share. If the two objects do not appear to share a class, the returned object's compile-time class will be Object.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the least common compile-time superclass of the object parameters
        Parameters:
        obj1 - the first object of type T
        obj2 - the second object of type T
        Returns:
        exactly one of the object parameters (either obj1 or obj2), of compile-time type T
        See Also:
        Class, Object

      • randObj

        public static <T> T randObj(java.util.ArrayList<T> objs)
        Returns a random object in a given ArrayList.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of objects in the ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        objs - the ArrayList from which to select the object.
        Returns:
        the randomly selected object from the ArrayList.

      • shuffle

        public static <T> java.util.ArrayList<T> shuffle(java.util.ArrayList<T> oldlist)
        Takes an ArrayList of objects and returns a new ArrayList of those same objects but in random order.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the least common compile-time superclass of the objects in the ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        oldlist - the ArrayList of objects.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList with the same objects, but in random order.
